column4: I'm having some strange problem with my clock on my server machine.
It's about 20% faster than normal. I used date -s "time" to reset it last night, and now it's 3h and 22 min off.
The npt update is turned of as of yesterday â€“ just in case. What can the problem be?
does this pose a problem with what the software the server runs??
It times out (if that's the correct word) when i'm usig hwclock, tried it last night
Yes it does, one of my apps is very dependent of the server clock
curious to now if the bios battery is dieing doubt it.
I'll call the maintainer and ask.
I wouldn't go that route I would go through log files see what the last update was before the clock started out of cycle..
hmm.. what is the condition of the room the server is in . I hope not a lot of dust and small and no air conditioning
I've no idea, it's an VPS
hope this doesn't stop business :( or interrupt business
It does, which isn't so great :(
not good.  No one on call for tech support?
this is usually when company's look to host on sight servers.... sorry to here the problem
